commit_message:
NetScaler driver for LBaaS V2 extension

Change-Id: I11ea5cb5a8583b2a627491edeac9de513f2f001a
Implements: blueprint netscaler-lbass-v2-driver
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/73/114173/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Citrix Systems, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json from neutron.api.v2 import attributes from neutron import context from neutron.db.loadbalancer import loadbalancer_db from neutron.openstack.common import log as logging from neutron.openstack.common import periodic_task from neutron.openstack.common import service from neutron.plugins.common import constants from neutron.services.loadbalancer.drivers import abstract_driver from neutron.services.loadbalancer.drivers.netscaler import ncc_client from oslo.config import cfg DEFAULT_STATUS_COLLECTION = "True" DEFAULT_interval = "2" DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE = "300" LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) NETSCALER_CC_OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt( 'netscaler_ncc_uri', help=_('The URL to reach the NetScaler Control Center Server.'), ), cfg.StrOpt( 'netscaler_ncc_username', help=_('Username to login to the NetScaler Control Center Server.'), ), cfg.StrOpt( 'netscaler_ncc_password', help=_('Password to login to the NetScaler Control Center Server.'), ), cfg.StrOpt( 'netscaler_status_collection', default=DEFAULT_STATUS_COLLECTION + "," + DEFAULT_interval + "," + DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE, help=_('Setting for status collection interval from NCC Server.'), ) ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(NETSCALER_CC_OPTS, 'netscaler_driver') VIP_IN_PENDING_CREATE = [] LBS_RESOURCE = 'loadbalancers' LB_RESOURCE = 'loadbalancer' LISTENERS_RESOURCE = 'listeners' LISTENER_RESOURCE = 'listener' VIPS_RESOURCE = 'vips' VIP_RESOURCE = 'vip' POOLS_RESOURCE = 'pools' POOL_RESOURCE = 'pool' POOLMEMBERS_RESOURCE = 'members' POOLMEMBER_RESOURCE = 'member' MONITORS_RESOURCE = 'healthmonitors' MONITOR_RESOURCE = 'healthmonitor' STATS_RESOURCE = 'stats' PROV_SEGMT_ID = 'provider:segmentation_id' PROV_NET_TYPE = 'provider:network_type' DRIVER_NAME = 'netscaler_driver' RESOURCE_PREFIX = 'v2.0/lb' STATUS_PREFIX = 'oca/v1' MEMBER_STATUS = 'memberstatus' PAGE = 'page' SIZE = 'size' class NetScalerLoadBalancerDriver(driver_base.LoadBalancerBaseDriver): def __init__(self, plugin): self.plugin = plugin # Each of the major LBaaS objects in the neutron database # need a corresponding manager/handler class. # # Put common things that are shared across the entire driver, like # config or a rest client handle, here. # # This function is executed when neutron-server starts. self.load_balancer = NetScalerLoadBalancerManager(self) self.listener = NetScalerListenerManager(self) self.pool = NetScalerPoolManager(self) self.member = NetScalerMemberManager(self) self.health_monitor = NetScalerHealthMonitorManager(self) class NetScalerCommonManager(object): def __init__(): self.payload_preparer = PayloadPreparer() def create(self, context, obj): LOG.debug("LB %s no-op, create %s", self.__class__.__name__, obj.id) self.create_entity(context, obj) def update(self, context, old_obj, obj): LOG.debug("LB %s no-op, update %s", self.__class__.__name__, obj.id) self.update_entity(context, old_obj, obj) def delete(self, context, obj): LOG.debug("LB %s no-op, delete %s", self.__class__.__name__, obj.id) self.delete_entity(context, obj) @abstract def create_entity(self, context, obj): @abstract def update_entity(self, context, old_obj, obj): @abstract def delete_entity(self, context, obj): class NetScalerLoadBalancerManager(NetScalerCommonManager, driver_base.BaseLoadBalancerManager): def refresh(self, context, lb_obj, force=False): # This is intended to trigger the backend to check and repair # the state of this load balancer and all of its dependent objects LOG.debug("LB pool refresh %s, force=%s", lb_obj.id, force) def stats(self, context, lb_obj): LOG.debug("LB stats %s", lb_obj.id) return { "bytes_in": 0, "bytes_out": 0, "active_connections": 0, "total_connections": 0 } def create_entity(self, context, loadbalancer): vip_subnet_id = loadbalancer['vip_subnet_id'] network_info = self.payload_preparer.get_network_info(context, vip_subnet_id) ncc_lb = self.payload_preparer.prepare_lb_for_creation(loadbalancer) ncc_lb = dict(ncc_lb.items() + network_info.items()) msg = _("NetScaler driver lb creation: %s") % repr(ncc_lb) LOG.debug(msg) status = constants.PENDING_CREATE resource_path = "%s/%s" %(RESOURCE_PREFIX, LBS_RESOURCE) self.client.create_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, LB_RESOURCE, ncc_lb) self.driver.plugin.activate_linked_entities(context, loadbalancer) def update_entity(self, context, old_loadbalancer, loadbalancer): update_lb = self.payload_preparer.prepare_lb_for_update(lb) resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, LBS_RESOURCE, lb["id"]) msg = (_("NetScaler driver lb %(lb_id)s update: %(lb_obj)s") % {"lb_id": lb["id"], "lb_obj": repr(lb)}) LOG.debug(msg) self.client.update_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, LB_RESOURCE, update_lb) self.driver.plugin.activate_linked_entities(context, loadbalancer) def delete_entity(self, context, loadbalancer): """Delete a loadbalancer on a NetScaler device.""" resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, LB_RESOURCE, lb["id"]) msg = _("NetScaler driver lb removal: %s") % lb["id"] LOG.debug(msg) self.client.remove_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path) self.driver.plugin._delete_db_loadbalancer(context, loadbalancer.id) class NetScalerListenerManager(NetScalerCommonManager, driver_base.BaseListenerManager): def create_entity(self, context, listener): ncc_listener = self.payload_preparer.prepare_listener_for_creation( listener) msg = _("NetScaler driver listener creation: %s") % repr(ncc_listener) LOG.debug(msg) status = constants.PENDING_CREATE resource_path = "%s/%s" %(RESOURCE_PREFIX, LISTENERS_RESOURCE) self.client.create_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, LISTENER_RESOURCE, ncc_listener) LISTENERS_TO_TRACK.append(listener["id"]) def update_entity(self, context, old_listener, listener): update_listener = self.payload_preparer.prepare_listener_for_update( listener) resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, LISTENERS_RESOURCE, listener["id"]) msg = (_("NetScaler driver listener %(listener_id)s " "update: %(listener_obj)s") % {"listener_id": listener["id"], "listener_obj": repr(listener)}) LOG.debug(msg) self.client.update_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, LISTENER_RESOURCE, update_listener) LISTENERS_TO_TRACK.append(listener["id"]) def delete_entity(self, context, listener): """Delete a listener on a NetScaler device.""" resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, LISTENER_RESOURCE, listener["id"]) msg = _("NetScaler driver listener removal: %s") % listener["id"] LOG.debug(msg) self.client.remove_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path) self.driver.plugin._delete_db_listener(context, listener.id) class NetScalerPoolManager(NetScalerCommonManager, driver_base.BasePoolManager): def create_entity(self, context, pool): """ This is never called""" pass def update_entity(self, context, old_pool, pool): update_pool = self.payload_preparer.prepare_pool_for_update(pool) resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, POOLS_RESOURCE, pool["id"]) msg = (_("NetScaler driver pool %(pool_id)s update: %(pool_obj)s") % {"pool_id": pool["id"], "pool_obj": repr(pool)}) LOG.debug(msg) self.client.update_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, POOL_RESOURCE, update_pool) def delete_entity(self, context, pool): """Delete a pool on a NetScaler device.""" resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, POOL_RESOURCE, pool["id"]) msg = _("NetScaler driver pool removal: %s") % pool["id"] LOG.debug(msg) self.client.remove_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path) self.driver.plugin._delete_db_pool(context, pool.id) class NetScalerMemberManager(NetScalerCommonManager, driver_base.BaseMemberManager): def create_entity(self, context, member): ncc_member = self.payload_preparer.prepare_member_for_creation(member) msg = _("NetScaler driver member creation: %s") % repr(ncc_member) LOG.debug(msg) status = constants.PENDING_CREATE resource_path = "%s/%s" %(RESOURCE_PREFIX, MEMBERS_RESOURCE) self.client.create_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, MEMBER_RESOURCE, ncc_member) def update_entity(self, context, old_member, member): update_member = self.payload_preparer.prepare_member_for_update(member) resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, MEMBERS_RESOURCE, member["id"]) msg = (_("NetScaler driver member %(member_id)s " "update: %(member_obj)s") % {"member_id": member["id"], "member_obj": repr(member)}) LOG.debug(msg) self.client.update_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, MEMBER_RESOURCE, update_member) def delete_entity(self, context, member): """Delete a member on a NetScaler device.""" resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, MEMBER_RESOURCE, member["id"]) msg = _("NetScaler driver member removal: %s") % member["id"] LOG.debug(msg) self.client.remove_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path) self.driver.plugin._delete_db_member(context, member.id) class NetScalerHealthMonitorManager(NetScalerCommonManager, driver_base.BaseHealthMonitorManager): def create_entity(self, context, hm): ncc_hm = self.payload_preparer.prepare_healthmonitor_for_creation( hm) msg = _("NetScaler driver healthmonitor creation: %s") % repr(ncc_hm) LOG.debug(msg) status = constants.PENDING_CREATE resource_path = "%s/%s" %(RESOURCE_PREFIX, MONITORS_RESOURCE) self.client.create_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, MONITOR_RESOURCE, ncc_hm) def update_entity(self, context, old_healthmonitor, hm): update_hm = self.payload_preparer.prepare_healthmonitor_for_update(hm) resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, MONITORS_RESOURCE, hm["id"]) msg = (_("NetScaler driver healthmonitor %(healthmonitor_id)s " "update: %(healthmonitor_obj)s") % {"healthmonitor_id": hm["id"], "healthmonitor_obj": repr(hm)}) LOG.debug(msg) self.client.update_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path, MONITOR_RESOURCE, update_hm) def delete_entity(self, context, hm): """Delete a healthmonitor on a NetScaler device.""" resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, MONITOR_RESOURCE, hm["id"]) msg = _("NetScaler driver healthmonitor removal: %s") % hm["id"] LOG.debug(msg) self.client.remove_resource(context.tenant_id, resource_path) self.driver.plugin._delete_db_healthmonitor(context, hm.id) class PayloadPreparer(): def prepare_lb_for_creation(self, lb): creation_attrs = { 'id': lb['id'], 'tenant_id': lb['tenant_id'], 'vip_address': lb['vip_address'], 'vip_port_id': lb['vip_port_id'], } update_attrs = self.prepare_lb_for_update(lb) creation_attrs.update(update_attrs) return creation_attrs def prepare_lb_for_update(self, lb): return { 'name': lb['name'], 'description': lb['description'], 'admin_state_up': lb['admin_state_up'], } def prepare_listener_for_creation(self, listener): creation_attrs = { 'id': listener['id'], 'tenant_id': listener['tenant_id'], 'protocol': listener['protocol'], 'protocol_port': listener['protocol_port'] } update_attrs = self.prepare_lb_for_update(listener) creation_attrs.update(update_attrs) return creation_attrs def prepare_listener_for_update(self, listener): listener_dict = { 'name': listener['name'], 'description': listener['description'], 'connection_limit': listener['connection_limit'], 'admin_state_up': listener['admin_state_up'] } if (listener.default_pool) : listener_dict['default_pool'] = { self.prepare_pool_for_listener(listener.default_pool) } def prepare_vip_for_creation(self, vip): creation_attrs = { 'id': vip['id'], 'tenant_id': vip['tenant_id'], 'protocol': vip['protocol'], 'address': vip['address'], 'protocol_port': vip['protocol_port'], } if 'session_persistence' in vip: creation_attrs['session_persistence'] = vip['session_persistence'] update_attrs = self.prepare_vip_for_update(vip) creation_attrs.update(update_attrs) return creation_attrs def prepare_vip_for_update(self, vip): return { 'name': vip['name'], 'description': vip['description'], 'pool_id': vip['pool_id'], 'connection_limit': vip['connection_limit'], 'admin_state_up': vip['admin_state_up'] } def prepare_pool_for_listener(self, pool): creation_attrs = { 'id': pool['id'], 'tenant_id': pool['tenant_id'], 'protocol': pool['protocol'] } update_attrs = self.prepare_pool_for_update(pool) creation_attrs.update(update_attrs) return creation_attrs def prepare_pool_for_update(self, pool): update_attrs = { 'name': pool['name'], 'description': pool['description'], 'lb_algorithm': pool['lb_algorithm'], 'admin_state_up': pool['admin_state_up'] } if (pool.sessionpersistence): pool_dict['sessionpersistence'] = { self.prepare_sessionpersistence(pool.sessionpersistence) } if (pool.members): pool_dict['members'] = { self.prepare_members_for_pool(pool.members) } return update_attrs def prepare_sessionpersistence(self, persistence): return { 'type': persistence['type'], 'cookie_name': persistence['cookie_name'] } def prepare_members_for_pool(self, members): members_attrs = [] for member in members: member_attrs = self.prepare_member_for_creation(member) members_attrs.append(member_attrs) return members_attrs def prepare_member_for_creation(self, member): creation_attrs = { 'id': member['id'], 'tenant_id': member['tenant_id'], 'address': member['address'], 'protocol_port': member['protocol_port'], } subnet_id = member['subnet_id'] network_info = self.get_network_info(context, subnet_id) creation_attrs = dict(creation_attrs.items() + network_info.items()) update_attrs = self.prepare_member_for_update(member) creation_attrs.update(update_attrs) return creation_attrs def prepare_member_for_update(self, member): return { 'weight': member['weight'], 'admin_state_up': member['admin_state_up'], } def prepare_healthmonitor_for_creation(self, health_monitor, pool_id): creation_attrs = { 'id': health_monitor['id'], 'tenant_id': health_monitor['tenant_id'], 'type': health_monitor['type'], } update_attrs = self.prepare_healthmonitor_for_update(health_monitor) creation_attrs.update(update_attrs) return creation_attrs def prepare_healthmonitor_for_update(self, health_monitor): ncc_hm = { 'delay': health_monitor['delay'], 'timeout': health_monitor['timeout'], 'max_retries': health_monitor['max_retries'], 'admin_state_up': health_monitor['admin_state_up'], } if health_monitor['type'] in ['HTTP', 'HTTPS']: ncc_hm['http_method'] = health_monitor['http_method'] ncc_hm['url_path'] = health_monitor['url_path'] ncc_hm['expected_codes'] = health_monitor['expected_codes'] return ncc_hm def get_network_info(self, context, subnet_id): network_info = {} subnet = self.plugin._core_plugin.get_subnet(context, subnet_id) network_id = subnet['network_id'] network = self.plugin._core_plugin.get_network(context, network_id) network_info['network_id'] = network_id network_info['subnet_id'] = subnet_id if PROV_NET_TYPE in network: network_info['network_type'] = network[PROV_NET_TYPE] if PROV_SEGMT_ID in network: network_info['segmentation_id'] = network[PROV_SEGMT_ID] return network_info def launch_status_collection(self, enable_status_collection, interval, pagesize, ncc_client, plugin): class Collectors(periodic_task.PeriodicTasks): @periodic_task.periodic_task(spacing= int(interval), enabled=enable_status_collection) def collect_status(self, context): msg = _("status collection interval: %s") % interval LOG.debug(msg) self._refresh_listener_status() def _refresh_listener_status(self): """Retrieve listener status from Control Center.""" for listener_id in LISTENERS_TO_TRACK: resource_path = "%s/%s/%s" % (RESOURCE_PREFIX, LISTENERS_RESOURCE, listener_id) status, result = ncc_client.retrieve_resource("GLOBAL", resource_path) msg = _("result is: %s") % (str(result)) LOG.debug(msg) result = json.loads(result['body']) status = result['listener']['status'] if status == constants.ACTIVE: context_handle = context.get_admin_context() plugin.update_status(context_handle, loadbalancer_db.Listener, listener_id, constants.ACTIVE) LISTENERS_TO_TRACK.remove(listener_id) class AsyncStatusCollectorService(service.Service): def start(self): super(AsyncStatusCollectorService, self).start() driver_conf = cfg.CONF.netscaler_driver conf_status_collection = driver_conf.netscaler_status_collection.split(",") enable_status_collection, interval, pagesize = conf_status_collection.split(",") self.tg.add_timer( int(interval), collectors.run_periodic_tasks, None, None ) collectors = Collectors() svc = AsyncStatusCollectorService() service.launch(svc)

commit_message:
Maintain l2 population fdb entries locally

Each ovs agent could maintain all l2 population fdb entries locally and
make every fdb add/remove/update operations thread-safe to improve the
reliability. When openvswitch restarts, ovs agent must recreate all
tunnel ports/flows if l2 population is used.

Change-Id: If9e4514db0cc9333fb8c8d28e53f6d1b8e1038a4
Closes-Bug: #1332450

added_lines: from neutron.openstack.common import lockutils self.l2_pop_fdb_cache = {} @lockutils.synchronized('fdb', 'ovs-agent') self._do_fdb_add(context, fdb_entries) def _do_fdb_add(self, context, fdb_entries): # maintain fdb locally if network_id not in self.l2_pop_fdb_cache: self.l2_pop_fdb_cache[network_id] = { 'segment_id': values.get('segment_id'), 'network_type': values.get('network_type'), 'ports': {}} cur_agent_ports = self.l2_pop_fdb_cache[network_id]['ports'] cur_ports = cur_agent_ports.get(agent_ip, []) if port not in cur_ports: self._add_fdb_flow(port, agent_ip, lvm, ofport) cur_ports.append(port) # Add flooding entry if not exist if q_const.FLOODING_ENTRY not in cur_ports: cur_ports.append(q_const.FLOODING_ENTRY) cur_agent_ports[agent_ip] = cur_ports @lockutils.synchronized('fdb', 'ovs-agent') self._do_fdb_remove(context, fdb_entries) def _do_fdb_remove(self, context, fdb_entries): if network_id not in self.l2_pop_fdb_cache: LOG.warning(_("fdb entities out of sync")) continue cur_agent_ports = self.l2_pop_fdb_cache[network_id]['ports'] cur_ports = cur_agent_ports.get(agent_ip, []) delete_flooding_entry = False for port in ports: if port == q_const.FLOODING_ENTRY: # check whether to remove flooding entry at last delete_flooding_entry = True continue else: if port not in cur_ports: LOG.warning(_("fdb %(fdb)s not in %(agent)s " "agent, ignore fdb remove"), {"fdb": port, "agent": agent_ip}) continue self._del_fdb_flow(port, agent_ip, lvm, ofport) cur_ports.remove(port) if delete_flooding_entry: left_ports = len(cur_ports) - cur_ports.count( q_const.FLOODING_ENTRY) if left_ports > 0: LOG.warning(_("agent %(agent)s has %(num)s ports " "left, not remove flooding entry"), {'agent': agent_ip, 'num': left_ports}) else: self._del_fdb_flow(q_const.FLOODING_ENTRY, agent_ip, lvm, ofport) cur_ports.remove(q_const.FLOODING_ENTRY) @lockutils.synchronized('fdb', 'ovs-agent') @lockutils.synchronized('fdb', 'ovs-agent') def _refresh_l2_pop_fdb_entries(self): for tunnel_type in self.tunnel_types: self.tun_br_ofports[tunnel_type].clear() old_fdb_entries = self.l2_pop_fdb_cache self.l2_pop_fdb_cache = {} self._do_fdb_add(None, old_fdb_entries) tunnel_sync = True if self.l2_pop: self._refresh_l2_pop_fdb_entries()
deleted_lines: self._add_fdb_flow(port, lvm, ofport) for port in ports: self._del_fdb_flow(port, lvm, ofport)

commit_message:
A bug of delete error status lb vip

When I delete the lb vip which is ERROR status, the lbaas namespace's tap
device not be deleted. When I add a new vip used the same ip address, then
the ip can not be used, because the ip address confilict.

Change-Id: I383037ae38b91e1fe36937c23f83e0c88a5b26db
Closes-Bug: #1399114

commit_message:
Apply 'int allowed vlan' cfg when one not there

This fixes a bug introduced by 1330597 which expects all Nexus devices
to return an error message when 'switchport trunk allowed vlan add' is
applied and this CLI currently is not applied.  Instead, code was
changed to get current interface config and check if this config is
not there.  It config currently applied, then 'add' keyword is used
in next config; otherwise, it is omitted.

Change-Id: I403848b73a7e69a3047b6eab337d16d17f293e17
Closes-bug:  #1395122

commit_message:
Adjust cap on python-ceilometerclient

The release of python-ceilometerclient 1.0.13 has incompatible
requirements with the rest of icehouse. This commit adjusts
the cap to make 1.0.12 the capped version to not install 1.0.13

Change-Id: If4479a0faea29c06a00e18ad7f67cc3f9c165e57
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/42/158842/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Implements OVSHybridInterfaceDriver for port security on
loadbalancer VIP.  Test by changing the interface_driver
in /etc/neutron/services/loadbalancer/haproxy/lbaas_agent.ini
from:
interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSInterfaceDriver
to:
interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.OVSHybridInterfaceDriver

Loadbalancer VIP tap device is now plugged into a linux bridge first,
so that iptables rules are created appropriately.  A veth pair is
created to connect the linux bridge to the ovs bridge.

commit_message:
Security groups don't work with vip and ovs plugin

Implements OVSHybridInterfaceDriver for port security on loadbalancer
VIP. Loadbalancer VIP tap device is now plugged into a linux bridge
first, so that iptables rules are created appropriately.  A veth pair
is created to connect the linux bridge to the ovs bridge.

Closes-Bug: #1163569
Change-Id: I064e3c0713000bd0c53f375a7f56a0dfb82c1ecd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/48/109848/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class OVSHybridInterfaceDriver(LinuxInterfaceDriver): """Driver for creating OVSHybrid Interfaces""" DEV_NAME_PREFIX = 'tap' def __init__(self, conf): super(OVSHybridInterfaceDriver, self).__init__(conf) # Get the names of the interfaces def _get_tap_name(self, port_id): return ("tap%s" % port_id)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN] def _get_veth_pair_names(self, port_id): return (("qvb%s" % port_id)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN], ("qvo%s" % port_id)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN]) def _get_br_name(self, port_id): return ("qbr%s" % port_id)[:self.DEV_NAME_LEN] def _ovs_add_port(self, bridge, device_name, port_id, mac_address, internal=True): cmd = ['ovs-vsctl', '--', '--if-exists', 'del-port', device_name, '--', 'add-port', bridge, device_name] if internal: cmd += ['--', 'set', 'Interface', device_name, 'type=internal'] cmd += ['--', 'set', 'Interface', device_name, 'external-ids:iface-id=%s' % port_id, '--', 'set', 'Interface', device_name, 'external-ids:iface-status=active', '--', 'set', 'Interface', device_name, 'external-ids:attached-mac=%s' % mac_address] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) def _br_add_bridge(self, bridge): cmd = ['brctl', 'addbr', bridge] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) cmd = ['ip', 'link', 'set', bridge, 'up'] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) cmd = ['brctl', 'setfd', bridge, 0] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) cmd = ['brctl', 'stp', bridge, 'off'] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) cmd = ['tee', ('/sys/class/net/%s/bridge/multicast_snooping' % bridge)] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) def _br_add_port(self, bridge, device_name): cmd = ['brctl', 'addif', bridge, device_name] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) def _br_del_port(self, bridge, device_name): cmd = ['brctl', 'delif', bridge, device_name] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) def _namespace_delete(self, namespace): cmd = ['ip', 'netns', 'delete', namespace] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) def _br_del_bridge(self, bridge): cmd = ['brctl', 'delbr', bridge] utils.execute(cmd, self.root_helper) def plug(self, network_id, port_id, device_name, mac_address, bridge=None, namespace=None, prefix=None): """Plug the interface.""" tap_name = self._get_tap_name(port_id) veth_qvb_name, veth_qvo_name = self._get_veth_pair_names(port_id) br_name = self._get_br_name(port_id) tap_dev = tap_name ns_dev = device_name ip = ip_lib.IPWrapper(self.root_helper) if namespace: namespace_obj = ip.ensure_namespace(namespace) if not ip_lib.device_exists(tap_dev, self.root_helper, namespace=namespace): ns_dev, tap_dev = ip.add_veth(tap_name, device_name, namespace2=namespace) ns_dev = ip.device(device_name) ns_dev.link.set_up() else: LOG.info(_("tap device %s already exists"), tap_dev) # Create linux bridge veth device and ovs bridge veth device qvb_dev, qvo_dev = ip.add_veth(veth_qvb_name, veth_qvo_name) # If the linux bridge does not exist, create it if not ip_lib.device_exists(br_name): self._br_add_bridge(br_name) else: LOG.info(_("Linux Bridge %s already exists"), br_name) # Attach the tap device to the linux bridge self._br_add_port(br_name, tap_dev) tap_dev.link.set_address(mac_address) tap_dev.link.set_up() # Attach the bridge veth side of the pair to the linux bridge, # if it exists if ip_lib.device_exists(qvb_dev): self._br_add_port(br_name, qvb_dev) qvb_dev.link.set_up() else: LOG.info(_("Linux bridge veth interface %s was not created"), qvb_dev) ovs_bridge = self.conf.ovs_integration_bridge ovs = ovs_lib.OVSBridge(ovs_bridge, self.root_helper) # Create the ovs bridge if it does not exist if not ovs.bridge_exists(ovs_bridge): ovs.add_bridge(ovs_bridge) # Attach the OVS veth side of the pair to the OVS bridge if ip_lib.device_exists(qvo_dev, self.root_helper): self._ovs_add_port(ovs_bridge, qvo_dev, port_id, mac_address, internal=False) qvo_dev.link.set_up() else: LOG.info(_("OVS veth interface %s was not created"), qvo_dev) if self.conf.network_device_mtu: tap_dev.link.set_mtu(self.conf.network_device_mtu) qvb_dev.link.set_mtu(self.conf.network_device_mtu) qvo_dev.link.set_mtu(self.conf.network_device_mtu) def unplug(self, device_name, bridge=None, namespace=None, prefix=None): """Unplug the interface.""" tap_name = device_name veth_qvb_dev = device_name.replace('tap', 'qvb') veth_qvo_dev = device_name.replace('tap', 'qvo') br_name = device_name.replace('tap', 'qbr') ovs_bridge = self.conf.ovs_integration_bridge self.check_bridge_exists(ovs_bridge) ovs = ovs_lib.OVSBridge(ovs_bridge, self.root_helper) try: ovs.delete_port(veth_qvo_dev) if self.conf.ovs_use_veth: device = ip_lib.IPDevice(veth_qvo_dev, self.root_helper) device.link.delete() LOG.debug(_("Unplugged interface '%s'"), veth_qvo_dev) except RuntimeError: LOG.error(_("Failed unplugging interface '%s'"), device_name) if ip_lib.device_exists(veth_qvb_dev): self._br_del_port(br_name, veth_qvb_dev) if ip_lib.device_exists(tap_name): device = ip_lib.IPDevice(tap_name, self.root_helper) device.link.delete() LOG.debug(_("Unplugged interface '%s'"), tap_name) if ip_lib.device_exists(br_name): device = ip_lib.IPDevice(br_name, self.root_helper) device.link.set_down() self._br_del_bridge(br_name) if namespace: self._namespace_delete(namespace)

commit_message:
Add servertimeout to be configurable for nuage plugin

Allows servertimeout to be configurable from neutron via
nuage_neutron_plugin.ini config value

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3e70d793cfcb4964583267ff8757de29c87a0035
Closes-Bug: #1360485

commit_message:
Use add-flow to add new flow instead of mod-flow

Although when calling ovs-ofctl mod-flows can be used to add flows, but
it is not intended, we should avoid the case.

Change-Id: I9a611b01efed652eb0d2521f84b07ce036e3c94a
Closes-bug: #1360145
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/116559/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.tun_br.add_flow(table=constants.FLOOD_TO_TUN, priority=1, else: # drop all packets if none destination tunnel is up. # this flow will be modified by _setup_tunnel_port when any # new tunnel port is up. self.tun_br.add_flow(table=constants.FLOOD_TO_TUN, priority=1, dl_vlan=lvid, actions="drop")

commit_message:
Move router constants to a specific  module

L3 agent module imports metadata driver module which will use (in
daughter change) router constants. That's why router constants must be
moved outside of L3 agent module to avoid an import loop between the 2
modules.

This change moves router constants to neutron.agent.l3.constants new
module because we cannot move router constants to router_info module
(it would imply an import loop between l3 router_info, l3 ha and
metadata driver modules).

Change-Id: Ic01edfde2c09578387b9bcbe649d99f1c6c53100
Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent
Partial-Bug: #1187102

Change allows ICMPv6 RAs by default

Change allows ICMPv6 RAs by default to reach to host
and ICPMv6 RS, NA, NS from host.

commit_message:
Donnot clear flows when restart ovs-neutron-agent.

At the first time loop of ports handling, ovs-neutron-agent
can rebuild the vlan mapping using current ports information
which can be got from ovs. So that when restarting
ovs-neutron-agent admin can specify the reset_ovs flag to
False to avoid the network interuption if the situation
below not happens:
1, change the router mode, such as normal<->dvr
2, enable/disable L2-pop/Arp-responder
3, change VxLAN UDP Port
4, change veth/patch connection method
5, change patch port name
6, tunnel port add/delete/ip-changed in no-l2-pop mode
7, add/delete one dvr in dvr mode
8, change the dvr mac in dvr mode
So if the config file changes, suggest just reset it.

Change-Id: I9b6e65b1d4e5e15f05541df11d9cb8944eb08bae
Closes-Bug: #1383674

Here we only error log LOG.error(_LE("Port bound tag error,pid: %(pid)s network type " "%(network_type)s for net-id=%(net_uuid)s" "cur tag is %(cur_tag), dl_vlan is %(dl_vlan)s"), {'network_type': lvm.network_type, 'pid':port.vif_id, 'net_uuid': net_uuid, 'cur_tag':cur_tag, 'dl_vlan':dl_vlan}) # Should we delete the match vlan action tunnel # in table FLOOD_TO_TUN and ARP_RESPONDER like bellow? #if network_type in constants.TUNNEL_NETWORK_TYPES: # if self.enable_tunneling: # # we should delete flows in phys br and tun br # # here is tun br # self.tun_br.delete_flows(table=constants.FLOOD_TO_TUN, # dl_vlan=cur_tag) # if not self.arp_responder_enabled: # # we should delete flows in phys br and tun br # # here is tun br # #also delete all arp flows # self.tun_br.delete_flows(table=constants.ARP_RESPONDER, # proto='arp', # dl_vlan=local_vid) # Should we also make dvr agent notified or clear the flows in # DVR_TO_SRC_MAC of dvr mode.DVR_PROCESS def setup_integration_br(self, ovs_restarted = False): # Only if when the ovs_restarted or need reset # should we clear all flows and rebuild patch port if cfg.CONF.reset_ovs or ovs_restarted: self.int_br.delete_port(cfg.CONF.OVS.int_peer_patch_port) self.int_br.remove_all_flows() def reset_tunnel_br(self, tun_br_name=None, ovs_restarted = False): if cfg.CONF.reset_ovs or ovs_restarted: self.tun_br.reset_bridge() else: self.tun_br.create() if cfg.CONF.reset_ovs or ovs_restarted: self.tun_br.remove_all_flows() def setup_physical_bridges(self, bridge_mappings, ovs_restarted = False): if cfg.CONF.reset_ovs or ovs_restarted: br.remove_all_flows() if cfg.CONF.reset_ovs or ovs_restarted: self.int_br.delete_port(int_if_name) br.delete_port(phys_if_name) if cfg.CONF.reset_ovs or ovs_restarted: ip_lib.IPDevice(int_if_name, self.root_helper).link.delete() # For the ports can be found in server db, we rebuild the # vlan mapping if it is the first time called in loop # and ovs_restarted not happened # to avoid change the flows for it. self.rebuild_local_vlan_mapping(devices_details_list, ovs_restarted) def rebuild_local_vlan_mapping(self, details, ovs_restarted): # If we restart ovs-db,we must re-provision the local vlan mapping # If we only restart the neutron-openvswitch-agent we not need re-provision # the local vlan mapping but rebuild vlan for the exist ports # when it is the first time after __init__ # So that the neutron-openvswitch-agent restart will not be # awared by the end-user if self.iter_num != 0 or ovs_restarted: return for detail in details: device = detail['device'] LOG.debug("Processing rebuild_local_vlan_mapping for port: %s", device) port = self.int_br.get_vif_port_by_id(device) if not port: # The port disappeared and cannot be processed LOG.info(_("Port %s was not found on the integration bridge " "and will therefore not be processed by" " rebuild_local_vlan_mapping"), device) continue network_id = detail['network_id'] if not network_id: # The port network_id not correct and cannot be processed LOG.info(_("network_id not configured for port %s " "and will therefore not be processed by" " rebuild_local_vlan_mapping"), device) continue cur_tag = self.int_br.db_get_val("Port", port.port_name, "tag") if cur_tag == DEAD_VLAN_TAG: LOG.info(_("cur_tag is DEAD_VLAN_TAG for port %s " "on the integration bridge " "and will therefore not be processed" " by rebuild_local_vlan_mapping"), device) continue self.local_vlan_map[network_id] = LocalVLANMapping(cur_tag, details['network_type'], details['physical_network'], details['segmentation_id']) LOG.info(_("cur_tag is %(vlan)s for port %(device)s" "of %(segmentation_id)s" "on the integration bridge " " by rebuild_local_vlan_mapping"), {'device':device, 'vlan':cur_tag, 'segmentation_id',details['segmentation_id']}) self.available_local_vlans.remove(cur_tag) self.setup_integration_br(ovs_restarted) self.setup_physical_bridges(self.bridge_mappings, ovs_restarted) if self.enable_tunneling: self.reset_tunnel_br(ovs_restarted) self.dvr_agent.setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_tun_br(ovs_restarted)

subject: Clean up CLI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-21 08:05:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/fa14ad2bfe4f9cd0615663e472fabdbfdc05312d', 'message': 'Clean up CLI

Strip out a lot of the OSC principals like ClientManager. These only
really make sense when you are trying to juggle auth between multiple
different clients and are confusing here.

Default to using the keystoneclient auth constructs as much as possible
including using the session when creating the client.

Change-Id: I0e4af38b99c08bd83d306928fff7eaf87ffe85f0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-16 01:06:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/dba50b566ee8b3146391c668430fc39d0f63db47', 'message': 'Clean up CLI

Strip out a lot of the OSC principals like ClientManager. These only
really make sense when you are trying to juggle auth between multiple
different clients and are confusing here.

Default to using the keystoneclient auth constructs as much as possible

commit_message:
Clean up CLI

Strip out a lot of the OSC principals like ClientManager. These only
really make sense when you are trying to juggle auth between multiple
different clients and are confusing here.

Default to using the keystoneclient auth constructs as much as possible
including using the session when creating the client.

Change-Id: I0e4af38b99c08bd83d306928fff7eaf87ffe85f0

commit_message:
Catch NoResultFound exception in get_vm_port_hostid

Cath the NoResultFound exception to avoid the l3
agent full-sync failure.

When the L3 Agent is restarting, the function
get_routers will be called to get all the routers
information which is called full-sync.

And when the RPC request is excuted in the
neutron-server side,the function stacks bellow
called:
l3_rpc.py:sync_routers->l3_dvr_db.py:get_sync_data->
l3_dvr_db.py:get_vm_port_hostid->self._core_plugin.get_port

If the floating ip of the port has been deleted
just right,the self._core_plugin.get_port
will raise exception.

The exception will not be caught. So this will make
the L3 Agent be interrupted and it has to sync
all the routers next cycle. It causes L3 Agent full-sync
fail.

So catch the NoResultFound exception to avoid the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1390920

Change-Id: I8911b941377122ef422aafbaa5eec3cc4b7622e2

commit_message:
Fix to maintain tenant-name same as project name

- re-used the variable which had the tenant-name in the log message
instead of fetching again from keystone.

Closes-Bug: #1370868

Change-Id: I15afbfec9a1d4f404bee56845b22cb9c86cfdb91

commit_message:
ovs_lib: Introduce get_bridge_name_for_datapath_id

This function returns the name of the bridge with the given datapath-id.

Closes-Bug: #1392581
Related: blueprint ofagent-bridge-setup
Change-Id: Ib544977e6d4705d00435dc10495dac6bb36af6c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/40/134440/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_bridge_name_for_datapath_id(root_helper, datapath_id): """Return the name of the bridge with the given datapath-id :param datapath_id: datapath-id as a hex string :type datapath_id: string :returns: the name of the bridge """ args = ["ovs-vsctl", "--timeout=%d" % cfg.CONF.ovs_vsctl_timeout, "--format=json", "--", "--columns=name", "find", "Bridge", "datapath_id=%s" % datapath_id] try: result_str = utils.execute(args, root_helper=root_helper) except Exception as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.exception(_LE("Unable to execute %(cmd)s. " "Exception: %(exception)s"), {'cmd': args, 'exception': e}) (row,) = jsonutils.loads(result_str.strip())['data'] (name,) = row return name

commit_message:
Fix Pluto pidfile deleting

Basically it is workaround, Pluto daemon doesn't delete his pid file
on CentOS while owner of parent dir is not root. It looks like some
tricky nuance with unlink function in pluto or specific  CentOS
behavoiur.

Change-Id: Ie1504ed5e73b7842e37fef384f16ed13a7f93a23
Closes-Bug: 1331502

commit_message:
Cisco N1KV: Missing tenant id in REST call to controller

Missing tenant id in the create port REST API to VSM (controller).
The fix is to add the missing tenant id parameter in the REST API.

Change-Id: Ib8aa1fdb487c85b9286eb5c0b34e683512e13378
Closes-Bug: 1373666

commit_message:
adopt namespace-less oslo imports

oslo.utils is now deprecated, so switching
from oslo.utils to right package oslo_utils.
similarly oslo.serialization also deprecated, it
is also switched to oslo_serialization from
oslo.serialization.

Change-Id: I9655f80bc5addc467e5d7c2c012e64bbabe37760
Closes-Bug: #1409733

commit_message:
Fix CSR1kv router service plugin REST failures due to DB lock timouts

The existing implementation did some operations during DB transactions,
which could lead to deadlocks and timeouts.  This patch changes the
implementation so that those operations are performed outside of the
DB transactions.

Change-Id: I4597b1a84a4077fd2f22fb0c371b2894304f4276
Closes-Bug: #1398433

commit_message:
[WIP] New iptables driver

The main class IptablesDriver provides API for controlling iptables.
FirewallDriver consuming security-groups and taking care of all chains
will follow.

commit_message:
Service Function Chain plugin

Change-Id: Ibf093b47f2d6f6b2e0929a22f904f1775286d944
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/83/146683/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Service Function Chain Plugin ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/sfc-plugin This blueprint describes the Service Function Chain plugin. Problem description =================== There is a need for a framework and common driver API that can be used for Service Function Chaining. This allows OpenStack Networking to separate common functonality for managing Service Function Chains from the vendor device specific drivers in the same manner as is done in the ML2 Plugin. Proposed change =============== This document describes the Service Function Chain Plugin in the OpenStack architecture. Common functionality includes the Service Chain database, the Service Function catalog and the Service Chain Driver API to interface to various vendor specific service chain drivers. The Service Chain Driver API includes the following resources: 1. Service Function (SF). The SF may directly represent a single SF instance or indirectly reference a group of SFs (SF Group). This is an instance of a SF such as a Firewall or IDS. 2. Service Locator. This represents addressing information used to reach a SF. 3. Service Function Group. A Service Function Group (SFG) is used to provide a local load-balancing capability over a group of Service Functions. 4. Service Function Chain. This is a Service Chain Instance that specifies the actual Service Functions to be included in the SFC. 5. Traffic Classifier. The ingress classifier selects the flows that will enter the Service Function Chain. It consists of a set of flow descriptors. 6. Flow Descriptor. The flow descriptor specifies a single flow for the traffic classifier. This work is intended to be done during the Kilo release. Alternatives ------------ There are no alternatives to what is proposed in this document. Data model impact ----------------- Migration scripts will be added to support the new resources. REST API impact --------------- Security impact --------------- All other create/update/delete operations will be restricted to administrators. Users will be able to query the service resources. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Integration with following projects will be required: * python-neutronclient * horizon * heat * devstack Performance Impact ------------------ No significant performance impact. Other deployer impact --------------------- No other impact. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Louis Fourie (louis.fourie@huawei.com) Other contributors: Cathy Zhang Work Items ---------- The work items include: 1. Implement CRUD operations to specify new resources 2. Implement Database updates to support that API 3. Implement Migration scripts to support the new DB items. Dependencies ============ This blueprint depends on Service Function Chaining [1]. Testing ======= Unit tests will be provided. Documentation Impact ==================== A description of the new attributes must be added to the documentation. References ========== [1] Group-based Policy Service Chaining https://github.com/stackforge/group-based-policy-specs/blob/master/specs/juno/group-based-policy-service-chaining.rst

commit_message:
Service Function Registration

Change-Id: I9f415e150526a59d48ac5898785ae79afc9006c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/14/147614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================= Service Function Registration API ================================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/advanced-services/+spec/sf-registration An external SF Manager may use this API to register (on-board) SF Instances with the SF database (catalog) within the Service Orchestrator. Problem description =================== Currently there is no mechanism for a third party SF manager to register its service functions with the Openstack orchestrator. Proposed change =============== The change will allow a third-party Service Function manager to register its service functions with the Openstack Orchestrator. The Service Function instances are stored in a SF database (SF catalog). When a service function chain (SFC) is created this SF database may be queried to obtain a matching SF instance that can be used in a service function chain. This work is intended to be done during the Kilo release. The following resources are used to register a SF instance with the Service Orchestrator: 1. Service Function (SF). The SF may directly represent a single SF instance or indirectly reference a group of SFs (SF Group). This is an instance of a SF such as a Firewall or IDS. In the data-plane, a SF may be SCH-aware or SCH-unaware. 2. Service Locator. This represents addressing information used to reach a SF. 3. Service Function Group. A Service Function Group (SFG) is used to provide a local load-balancing capability over a group of Service Functions. A. Service Function. The attributes for the Service Function resource are shown below. +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |Attribute |Type |Access |Default |CRUD|Description | |Name | | |Value | | | +=============+==========+========+=========+====+===================+ |id |string |RO, all |generated|R |identity | | |(UUID) | | | | | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |tenant_id |uuid-str |RO, all |from auth|CR |Tenant Id | | | | |token | | | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |name |string |RW, all |'' |CRU |human-readable | | | | | | |name | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |description |string |RW, all |'' |CRU |human-readable | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |type |Enum |RW, all |None |CR |SF type: FW, IDS, | | | | | | |NAT, DPI, etc. | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |flavor |String |RW, all |None |CR |Heat template URL, | | | | | | |or name-value pairs| +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |locators |List |RW, all |None |CRU |List of Locator | | |(uuid-str)| | | |UUIDs. May be a | | | | | | |list of UUID pairs | | | | | | |where 1st item in | | | | | | |pair is the ingress| | | | | | |port & 2nd item is | | | | | | |the egress port | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |sch_type |Enum |RW, all |None |CRU |SCH encap type: | | | | | | |none, sch, mac | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |mgmt_address |Integer |RW, all |None |CRU |Mgmt address of SF | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |sf_group |uuid-str |RW, all |None |CR |UUID of SF group to| | | | | | |which this SF | | | | | | |belongs. | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ B. Service Locator. The attributes for the Service Locator resource are shown below. +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |Attribute |Type |Access |Default |CRUD|Description | |Name | | |Value | | | +=============+==========+========+=========+====+===================+ |id |string |RO, all |generated|R |identity | | |(UUID) | | | | | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |tenant_id |uuid-str |RO, all |from auth|CR |Tenant Id | | | | |token | | | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |name |string |RW, all |'' |CRU |human-readable | | | | | | |name | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |description |string |RW, all |'' |CRU |human-readable | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |type |Enum |RW, all |None |CR |l2-address, vxlan | | | | | | |l3-address, gre | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |l3_address |Integer |RW, all |None |CR |IP-address | | | | | | |(type=l3-address) | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |port |Integer |RW, all |None |CR |TCP port | | | | |address | |(type=l3-address) | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |l2_address |Integer |RW, all |None |CR |MAC address | | | | | | |(type=l2-address) | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |vlan_id |Integer |RW, all |None |CR |VLAN ID | | | | | | |(type=l2-address) | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |vxlan_ip |Integer |RW, all |None |CR |VXLAN IP-address | | | | | | |(type=vxlan) | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |gre_ip |Integer |RW, all |None |CR |GRE IP-address | | | | | | |(type=l3-address) | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |sf_id |uuid-str |RO, all |None |CR |UUID of SF for this| | | | | | |locator | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ C. Service Function Group. The attributes for the Service Function Group resource are shown below. +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |Attribute |Type |Access |Default |CRUD|Description | |Name | | |Value | | | +=============+==========+========+=========+====+===================+ |id |string |RO, all |generated|R |identity | | |(UUID) | | | | | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |tenant_id |uuid-str |RO, all |from auth|CR |Tenant Id | | | | |token | | | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |name |string |RW, all |'' |CRU |human-readable | | | | | | |name | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |description |string |RW, all |'' |CRU |human-readable | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |type |Enum |RW, all |None |CR |SF type: FW, IDS, | | | | | | |NAT, DPI, etc. | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |algorithm |Enum |RW, all |random |CRU |Load distribution | | | | | | |algorithm: random, | | | | | | |round-robin, etc. | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |hash_field |Enum |RW, all |Source IP|CR |Field used for | | | | |address | |hashing: SIP, DIP, | | | | | | |Sport, Dport, etc. | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ |service_fns |List |RW, all |None |CRU |List of SF UUIDs. | | |(uuid-str)| | | | | +-------------+----------+--------+---------+----+-------------------+ Alternatives ------------ There are no alternatives to what is proposed in this document. Data model impact ----------------- Migration scripts will be added to support the new resources. REST API impact --------------- A new file sf_registration.py will include the new resources shown below:: RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = { SERVICE_FUNCTIONS: { 'id': {'allow_post': False, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:uuid': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'primary_key': True}, 'name': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'default': '', 'is_visible': True}, 'description': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': ''}, 'tenant_id': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': False, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'required_by_policy': True, 'is_visible': True}, 'sf_type': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'default': '', 'is_visible': True, 'required': False}, 'sch_type': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, 'is_visible': True, 'default': '', 'required': True}, 'mgmt_address': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'default': None, 'convert_to': convert_to_int_or_none, 'is_visible': True, 'required': False}, 'sf_group': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True, 'validate': {'type:string': None}, administrators. Users will be able to query the service resources. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Integration with following projects will be required: * python-neutronclient * horizon * heat * devstack Performance Impact ------------------ No significant performance impact. Other deployer impact --------------------- No other impact. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Louis Fourie (louis.fourie@huawei.com) Other contributors: Cathy Zhang Work Items ---------- The work items include: 1. Implement CRUD operations to specify new resources. 2. Implement Database updates to support that API. 3. Implement Migration scripts to support the new DB items. 4. Implement python-neutronclient changes for CLI. 5. Implement Horizon changes. Dependencies ============ This blueprint depends on Group Based Policy Service Chaining [1]. Testing ======= Unit tests will be provided. Documentation Impact ==================== A description of the new attributes must be added to the documentation. References ========== [1] Group-based Policy Service Chaining https://blueprints.launchpad.net/group-based-policy/+spec/group-based-policy-service-chaining

subject: lbaas package should be installed before service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 17:45:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/1c12ba7b01b1ee8918673a3a430fdf31f1708093', 'message': 'lbaas package should be installed before service

There was no explicit ordering between the lbaass service and package
which of course broke stuff.

Change-Id: Ic718f88023c8e8ad41cd9888e230ebb78dcca943
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-24 18:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/agents/lbaas.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/38553ca82d643c7298c371badaa1e41afc48a08b', 'message': 'lbaas package should be installed before service

There was no explicit ordering between the lbaass service and package
which of course broke stuff.

Change-Id: Ic718f88023c8e8ad41cd9888e230ebb78dcca943
'}]
commit_message:
lbaas package should be installed before service

There was no explicit ordering between the lbaass service and package
which of course broke stuff.

Change-Id: Ic718f88023c8e8ad41cd9888e230ebb78dcca943
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/94/158794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Package['neutron'] -> Package['neutron-lbaas-agent'] Package['neutron-lbaas-agent'] -> Service['neutron-lbaas-service']

subject: Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE in ip allocation code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-06-18 17:18:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1b84334ce1e1d83a387f8fbcfd148df8c52a95ad', 'message': 'Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE lock from db_base_plugin

Instead of using the SELECT FOR UPDATE db lock, ensure data consistency
using a global lock. A thread will acquire this lock before performing
an operation on the DB that could lead to incosistent data.
This approach should have no negative impact on the overall performance.

Closes-bug: #1331564

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-18 17:19:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9e05ce2ebe154f39673b1deb89e04c22b2489a26', 'message': 'Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE lock from db_base_plugin (WIP)

Instead of using the SELECT FOR UPDATE db lock, ensure data consistency
using a global lock. A thread will acquire this lock before performing
an operation on the DB that could lead to incosistent data.
This approach should have no negative impact on the overall performance.

Closes-bug: #1331564

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-06 19:45:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b9ae485de8eed32c9677e4a913cb70fc50b7de9a', 'message': "Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE from db_base_plugin

Instead of using a SELECT FOR UPDATE to ensure consistency
put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other
process modified it. If a modification occurred the operation will
be retried after getting a fresh copy of the data from the DB.
IPAllocation is created right after the IP range update.

SELECT FOR UPDATE is removed from _rebuild_availability_ranges.
This function is called if there's no IPAvailabilityRange available
for a subnet or by _update_subnet_allocation_pools which removes
the IPAvailabilityRange associated with the subnet before calling
_rebuild_availability_ranges. In any case no IP can be generated
by another process for this subnet since there's no
IPAvailabilityRange record in the DB. Two processes could perform
_rebuild_availability_ranges at the same time, that's why a
DBDuplicateEntry is catched.

delete_network and delete_subnet instead of using SELECT FOR UPDATE
delete the ports that are allowed to be auto deleted straight away.
Then a check is performed, if there are ports still associated
with the network or the subnet that cannot be autodeleted,
an exception is raised. The operation will be rolled back.

Closes-bug: #1331564

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c

DB_MAX_RETRIES is introduced in neutron.common.constants to define
the maximum number of times that a DB operation can be retried

"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2014-08-26 13:56:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1a2ac514bb16f2f7a740a9c6f262c1f6f9670efe', 'message': "Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE from db_base_plugin

Instead of using a SELECT FOR UPDATE to ensure consistency
put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other
process modified it. If a modification occurred the operation will
be retried after getting a fresh copy of the data from the DB.
IPAllocation is created right after the IP range update.

SELECT FOR UPDATE is removed from _rebuild_availability_ranges.
This function is called if there's no IPAvailabilityRange available
for a subnet or by _update_subnet_allocation_pools which removes
the IPAvailabilityRange associated with the subnet before calling
_rebuild_availability_ranges. In any case no IP can be generated
by another process for this subnet since there's no
IPAvailabilityRange record in the DB. Two processes could perform
_rebuild_availability_ranges at the same time, that's why a
DBDuplicateEntry is catched.

delete_network and delete_subnet instead of using SELECT FOR UPDATE
delete the ports that are allowed to be auto deleted straight away.
Then a check is performed, if there are ports still associated
with the network or the subnet that cannot be autodeleted,
an exception is raised. The operation will be rolled back.

DB_MAX_RETRIES is introduced in neutron.common.constants to define
the maximum number of times that a DB operation can be retried

Closes-bug: #1331564
Closes-bug: #1332923
Closes-bug: #1313851

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c

put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other

"}, {'number': 22, 'created': '2014-09-22 14:22:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/db40fdfe37c32044adbda7f170690ff4166d57fe', 'message': "Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE in ip allocation code

Instead of using a SELECT FOR UPDATE to ensure consistency
put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other
process modified it. If a modification occurred the operation will
be retried after getting a fresh copy of the data from the DB.
IPAllocation is created right after the IP range update.

SELECT FOR UPDATE is removed from _rebuild_availability_ranges.
This function is called if there's no IPAvailabilityRange available
for a subnet or by _update_subnet_allocation_pools which removes
the IPAvailabilityRange associated with the subnet before calling

"}, {'number': 27, 'created': '2014-10-24 17:45:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/abdb26cb94d79a8f750034efd8f460f24900f316', 'message': "Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE in ip allocation code

Instead of using a SELECT FOR UPDATE to ensure consistency
put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other
process modified it. If a modification occurred the operation will
be retried after getting a fresh copy of the data from the DB.
IPAllocation is created right after the IP range update.

SELECT FOR UPDATE is removed from _rebuild_availability_ranges.
This function is called if there's no IPAvailabilityRange available
for a subnet or by _update_subnet_allocation_pools which removes
the IPAvailabilityRange associated with the subnet before calling
_rebuild_availability_ranges. In any case no IP can be generated
by another process for this subnet since there's no
IPAvailabilityRange record in the DB. Two processes could perform
_rebuild_availability_ranges at the same time, that's why a
DBDuplicateEntry is catched.

This change moves DB_MAX_ENTRIES to constants in order to make it
available for reference from this new code.

In _try_generate_ip IPAllocationFailure is raised instead of
IpAddressGenerationFailure to be consistent with the decorator
_retry_ip_allocation. _generate_ip is refactored accordingly

Closes-bug: #1331564
Closes-bug: #1332923
Closes-bug: #1313851

Co-Authored-By: Carl Baldwin <carl.baldwin@hp.com>

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c

commit_message:
Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE in ip allocation code

Instead of using a SELECT FOR UPDATE to ensure consistency
put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other
process modified it. If a modification occurred the operation will
be retried after getting a fresh copy of the data from the DB.
IPAllocation is created right after the IP range update.

SELECT FOR UPDATE is removed from _rebuild_availability_ranges.
This function is called if there's no IPAvailabilityRange available
for a subnet or by _update_subnet_allocation_pools which removes
the IPAvailabilityRange associated with the subnet before calling
_rebuild_availability_ranges. In any case no IP can be generated
by another process for this subnet since there's no
IPAvailabilityRange record in the DB. Two processes could perform
_rebuild_availability_ranges at the same time, that's why a
DBDuplicateEntry is catched.

This change moves DB_MAX_ATTEMPTS to constants in order to make it
available for reference from this new code.

In _try_generate_ip IPAllocationFailure is raised instead of
IpAddressGenerationFailure to be consistent with the decorator
_retry_ip_allocation. _generate_ip is refactored accordingly

Partial-bug: #1331564
Closes-bug: #1332923
Closes-bug: #1313851

Co-Authored-By: Carl Baldwin <carl.baldwin@hp.com>

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c

added_lines: import contextlibfrom neutron.openstack.common import lockutils with contextlib.nested(lockutils.lock('db-ipam')): range_qry = context.session.query( models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange).join( models_v2.IPAllocationPool) for subnet in subnets: range = range_qry.filter_by(subnet_id=subnet['id']).first() if not range: LOG.debug(_("All IPs from subnet %(subnet_id)s (%(cidr)s) " "allocated"), {'subnet_id': subnet['id'], 'cidr': subnet['cidr']}) continue ip_address = range['first_ip'] LOG.debug(_("Allocated IP - %(ip_address)s from %(first_ip)s " "to %(last_ip)s"), {'ip_address': ip_address, 'first_ip': range['first_ip'], 'last_ip': range['last_ip']}) if range['first_ip'] == range['last_ip']: # No more free indices on subnet => delete LOG.debug("No more free IP's in slice. Deleting " "allocation pool.") context.session.delete(range) else: # increment the first free range['first_ip'] = str(netaddr.IPAddress(ip_address) + 1) return {'ip_address': ip_address, 'subnet_id': subnet['id']} raise n_exc.IpAddressGenerationFailure( net_id=subnets[0]['network_id']) with contextlib.nested(lockutils.lock('db-ipam')): ip_qry = context.session.query( models_v2.IPAllocation) # PostgreSQL does not support select...for update with an # outer join. # No join is needed here. pool_qry = context.session.query( models_v2.IPAllocationPool).options( orm.noload('available_ranges')) for subnet in sorted(subnets): LOG.debug(_("Rebuilding availability ranges for subnet %s") % subnet) # Create a set of all currently allocated addresses ip_qry_results = ip_qry.filter_by(subnet_id=subnet['id']) allocations = netaddr.IPSet([netaddr.IPAddress(i['ip_address']) for i in ip_qry_results]) for pool in pool_qry.filter_by(subnet_id=subnet['id']): # Create a set of all addresses in the pool poolset = netaddr.IPSet(netaddr.iter_iprange( pool['first_ip'], pool['last_ip'])) # Use set difference to find free addresses in the pool available = poolset - allocations # Generator compacts an ip set into contiguous ranges def ipset_to_ranges(ipset): first, last = None, None for cidr in ipset.iter_cidrs(): if last and last + 1 != cidr.first: yield netaddr.IPRange(first, last) first = None first, last = first if first else cidr.first, cidr.last if first: # Write the ranges to the db for range in ipset_to_ranges(available): available_range = models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange( allocation_pool_id=pool['id'], first_ip=str(netaddr.IPAddress(range.first)), last_ip=str(netaddr.IPAddress(range.last))) context.session.add(available_range) with contextlib.nested(lockutils.lock('db-ipam')): ip = int(netaddr.IPAddress(ip_address)) range_qry = context.session.query( models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange).join( models_v2.IPAllocationPool) results = range_qry.filter_by(subnet_id=subnet_id) for range in results: first = int(netaddr.IPAddress(range['first_ip'])) last = int(netaddr.IPAddress(range['last_ip'])) if first <= ip <= last: if first == last: context.session.delete(range) return elif first == ip: range['first_ip'] = str(netaddr.IPAddress( ip_address) + 1) return elif last == ip: range['last_ip'] = str(netaddr.IPAddress( ip_address) - 1) return else: # Split into two ranges new_first = str(netaddr.IPAddress(ip_address) + 1) new_last = range['last_ip'] range['last_ip'] = str(netaddr.IPAddress( ip_address) - 1) ip_range = models_v2.IPAvailabilityRange( allocation_pool_id=range['allocation_pool_id'], first_ip=new_first, last_ip=new_last) context.session.add(ip_range) return context.session.query(models_v2.Port).filter_by( network_id=id, device_owner=constants.DEVICE_OWNER_DHCP).delete() ports_in_use = context.session.query(models_v2.Port).filter_by( network_id=id).all() if ports_in_use: with contextlib.nested(lockutils.lock('db-ipam')): context.session.query(models_v2.IPAllocationPool).filter_by( subnet_id=id).delete() new_pools = [models_v2.IPAllocationPool( first_ip=p['start'], last_ip=p['end'], subnet_id=id) for p in s['allocation_pools']] context.session.add_all(new_pools) NeutronDbPluginV2._rebuild_availability_ranges(context, [s]) #Gather new pools for result: result_pools = [{'start': pool['start'], 'end': pool['end']} for pool in s['allocation_pools']] del s['allocation_pools'] return result_pools with contextlib.nested(lockutils.lock('db-ipam'), context.session.begin(subtransactions=True)): filter_by(network_id=subnet['network_id']))

subject: Add a custom pylint check for misused context managers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-10 06:21:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/06db4665cd4d9b24aacfd3a56df198fa6a308891', 'message': "Add a custom pylint check for misused context managers

Some classes (eg: locking, eventlet.timeout, etc) are intended to only
be used via 'with' statements. This change introduces a pylint check
that verifies certain classes are only used in this way.

For example, this catches errors like that described/fixed in
I1bfc5af6917c525894eecd8b477d787763edbd02

Bad:
  eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout)
  do_something()

Good:
  with eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout):
    do_something()

Change-Id: I1a51118d951d774bdf78d3944e801e2efc817646
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-10 06:38:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/de69dc544474008e94a5293d2a77f2f20e04cfb5', 'message': "Add a custom pylint check for misused context managers

commit_message:
Add a custom pylint check for misused context managers

Some classes (eg: locking, eventlet.timeout, etc) are intended to only
be used via 'with' statements. This change introduces a pylint check
that verifies certain classes are only used in this way.

For example, this catches errors like that described/fixed in
I1bfc5af6917c525894eecd8b477d787763edbd02

Bad:
  eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout)
  do_something()

Good:
  with eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout):
    do_something()

Change-Id: I1a51118d951d774bdf78d3944e801e2efc817646
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/20/120320/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Looks like there's a pylint bug if load-plugins is used in pylintrc # to register a plugin that in turn registers its own options in # pylintrc. Workaround is to use --load-plugins on the command line # instead. pylint --load-plugins=neutron.pylint.usagecheck --rcfile=.pylintrc --output-format=colorized {posargs:neutron}

commit_message:
Missing mock causing long tests

The test wasn't mocking a call to change the power state of the fake
node, which was causing this test to account for 14 of 17 seconds
on my machine.

Change-Id: I8fe77ded3365375f569574c24430027053ef0dd3

commit_message:
WIP: Set VLAN tags on l3 gateway ports

When running multiple provider networks as external nets, we have to
use multiple bridges - one per provider network - because the l3 agent
is creating ports without setting the matching VLAN tag on them.

Adding the tag to the ports permits this to be much lighter on machine
configuration, but will break deployments that have a manually
configured VLAN underneath the bridge. To support that we make this
feature be controlled by an option.

Co-Authored-By: Jan Grant <jan.grant@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chuck Carlino <ccarlino@hp.com>
Fixes-Bug: #1346494
Change-Id: I81d896f8b5356fdc995549f2c00af54b935ef690

commit_message:
NSX: allow for updating network gateway devices

The gateway extensions API disallowed this kind of update.
However, this is supported by the backend, and can be easily
supported by the plugin with minimal changes.

This patch adds supports for updating the list of devices for a
network gateway. As the whole list is treated as a single
attribute, the update will have the effect of replacing the
current device list with the new one.

This patch also adds support for this use case in the fake NSX
API client.

Change-Id: Ib6e70ae92a2b32f475c0fda9255e2b862715f68a
Closes-Bug: #1341791

added_lines: def test_update_network_gateway_with_devices(self): tenant_id = _uuid() with contextlib.nested( self._gateway_device(name='dev_old', tenant_id=tenant_id), self._gateway_device(name='dev_new', tenant_id=tenant_id)) as (dev_1, dev_2): dev_1_id = dev_1[self.dev_resource]['id'] dev_2_id = dev_2[self.dev_resource]['id'] old_devices = [{'id': dev_1_id, 'interface_name': 'xxx'}] new_devices = [{'id': dev_2_id, 'interface_name': 'yyy'}] with self._network_gateway(devices=old_devices, tenant_id=tenant_id) as gw: upd_data = {self.gw_resource: {'name': 'new_name', 'devices': new_devices}} upd_req = self.new_update_request(networkgw.NETWORK_GATEWAYS, upd_data, gw[self.gw_resource]['id']) self.assertEqual( 200, upd_req.get_response(self.ext_api).status_int) show_req = self.new_show_request(networkgw.NETWORK_GATEWAYS, gw[self.gw_resource]['id']) show_res = self.deserialize( 'json', show_req.get_response(self.ext_api)) self.assertEqual(upd_data[self.gw_resource]['name'], show_res[self.gw_resource]['name']) self.assertEqual(upd_data[self.gw_resource]['devices'], show_res[self.gw_resource]['devices'])
